text.__SUMMARY__: Pseudobombax ellipticum, with common names including shaving brush tree and amapolla tree, is a species of plant in the subfamily Bombacoideae of the family Malvaceae.
text.Distribution: The tree is native to southern Mexico, El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras.and Cuba
text.Description:
Pseudobombax elipticum is a tree that can reach 18 m (60 ft) in height and 1.3 m (4 ft) d.b.h. Its branches are close to the base of the stem. It is a deciduous tree with succulent stems.
The flowers are fragrant.
text.Uses:
Uses include firewood and wood for carving handicrafts.
The attractive flowers are used to decorate homes and churches in Central America. In Central America, a highly intoxicating drink is made from the tree.
CultivationThe tree is grown as an ornamental tree in Florida, Hawaii, and coastal Southern California.
